Prepare to embark on an epic journey as you ascend the slopes of the Himalayan peaks. The objective is for you (or your team) to have scored the most points at the end of the game when the expedition reaches the Summit.

At each Altitude Level, you make a bid for the number of tricks you think you will take and your goal is to reach exactly that bid without going over or under. If you reach your bid, you receive points; otherwise, you lose points.

—description from the designer

Name: Ruthless 86
Description:
Scorpion Supreme is dead and the Subcommanders in the Scorp Corps are staking their claim to the title.

In Ruthless 86, you take on the role of a brash, outrageous 80s cartoon villain, like steampunk pirate Molly Roger, the enigmatic and unknowable Sylence, or Tyrannoczar, a super soldier cloned from the DNA of history’s greatest rulers plus a T-Rex. 
 Prove to your rivals that you deserve to inherit the Scorpion Supreme title from your mysteriously departed leader. Win the loyalty of a legion of disposable Scorpion Soldiers and send them on Missions around the World. Expand and fortify your HexQuarters, your remote lair. Commandeer your evil organization’s Doomsday Devices. Stab backs, 86 your enemies, and, most of all, get Ruthless.

Ruthless 86 is a dice builder worker placement game. Recruit and deploy Troopers to battle stations in your remote HexQuarters, or combine six on a die to form a unit and deploy them on Missions across the World. Successful Missions expand your reach and Fortify your HexQuarters. When you feel you've built up a strong enough army, deploy to The Ranks and attempt to be the first to rise to the top and become the new Scorpion Supreme.

—description from the designer

Name: Caverna: The Forgotten Folk – Adventurers Promo
Description: Promo for the Caverna expansion The Forgotten Folk. Instead of dwarves as usual, a player can now also colonize the mountain as an Adventurer.

Name: The Good, the Bad, and the Munchkin: Complete Edition
Description:
The Good, the Bad, and the Munchkin opens a whole new frontier for munchkins — the Wild West! Forget dragons and goblins — jackalopes and Davy Croc have just as much treasure to loot. Those plains may seem wide open, but there's lots of monsters to kill and lots of stuff to take.

Become a Cowboy with a Twenty-Gallon Hat, or an Indian on a Catamount. Fight Wild Bill Hiccup, the Killer Jalapeno, and a Barber Shop Quartet. Take The Annual Bath for an extra level. Or just pal around with your sidekick the Greenhorn, until you sacrifice him to distract a monster.

The Good, the Bad, and the Munchkin: Complete Edition contains the original base game, all the cards from the Beating a Dead Horse expansion, each Western-themed promo card released, and thematic bookmarks that each contain a new rule for play.

Name: Hanabi Deluxe II
Description:
Hanabi — named for the Japanese word for "fireworks" — is a co-operative game in which players try to create the perfect fireworks show by placing the cards on the table in the right order. (In Japanese, hanabi is written as èŠ±ç«; these are the ideograms flower and fire, respectively.)

The card deck consists of five different colors of cards, numbered 1–5 in each color. For each color, the players try to place a row in the correct order from 1–5. Sounds easy, right? Well, not quite, as in this game you hold your cards so that they're visible only to other players. To assist other players in playing a card, you must give them hints regarding the numbers or the colors of their cards. Players must act as a team to avoid errors and to finish the fireworks display before they run out of cards.

Hanabi Deluxe II is similar to the Hanabi Deluxe edition first released in 2013, which features the same gameplay as the original game, but with the cards being replaced by Mah Jhong-style tiles. Hanabi Deluxe II includes six unique tiles that comprise the "Master Artisan" expansion.

Name: Transformers Trading Card Game: Rise of the Combiners
Description:
The Transformers Trading Card Game is a battling card game designed for two players. Players build a team of Transformers character cards and power them up with a customizable deck of battle cards. Transformers character cards are twice the size of standard playing cards; they can be flipped from bot mode to alt mode and back, and they feature premium printing treatment on one of their sides. The deck of battle cards features Action and Upgrade cards to enhance Transformers character cards.

Transformers TCG: Rise of the Combiners features the debut of combiners — character cards that combine to create a single giant robot! This expansion contains six combiner groups, including Predaking. Characters combine using new "Enigma" cards and by having all parts of the combiner in bot mode on the battlefield or in the KO area. Each section of the combiner may have an upgrade, and all damage from each section carries over to the new combiner bot.

Name: Tuttiludi
Description:
This is a compilation of games, played with a spinner or roulette.

1. Bilder-Roulette (Picture-Roulette)
The 32 picture cards (animals) are are dealt up among the players. After the spin of the roulette, the indicated card is dicarded of. The first player to discard all his cards wins the game.

2. Buchstaben-Roulette (Letter-Roulette)
Before playing, the players chose a number of topics (city, country, ...). To beginn the game the spinner is moved to select a letter. Then time runs. Every player has to find words for the chosen topics with the indicated letter.

3. Zahlen-Roulette (Numbers-Roulette)
The goal of the came can be to get the highest or lowest numbers or to get a connecting line on a grid of numbers.

4. Karten-Roulette (Card-Roulette)
This game is played with a standard deck of 32 playing cards. The players buy cards for one coin a card from the game master. Then he spins the roulette 5 times. On the first spin the winning card gets gets the player two coins. On the next spins the players win 4, 6, 8 and 10 coins.

5. Immer mit der Ruhe
This is a standard Pachisi game, played with a spinner insead of a die. In addition the spanner may be used to determine which color is to be moved, so the players dont get their turns in regular intervals.

Name: Urbin-Spiel
Description:
The journey begins and ends in Berlin. Movement is determined by a die. In some cities events hinder or help the players. The first player to return to Berlin wins the game.

This game was published as a promotional game for "Urbin" shoe polish between the first and second world war.

—user summary

Name: Opération Archéo: Nouveaux Défis
Description:
This is the first expansion for the boardgame "Opération Archéo".
More scenarios; more items to collect; more archaeologists to join the staff. New mechanisms increase the challenge of your researches!

Name: Crocodile Islands
Description:
Crocodile Islands is a wooden dexterity game where 2-6 players take turns to place “crocodiles” onto islands but avoiding them “snapping” together.

The crocodiles have magnets embedded so they either attract or repel depending on their orientation.  The islands are player placed and as such can vary the amount of space available for crocodiles making the game variably more difficult (and likely shorter) or easier.

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – In The Clutches of Chaos: Mythos Pack
Description:
In the Clutches of Chaos is the fifth Mythos Pack in The Circle Undone cycle for Arkham Horror: The Card Game.

After your fateful investigation in Union and Disillusion, the state of the city continues to decay. Breaches in reality begin to rip through the fabric of the Earth, and a faint melody of discordant pipes can be heard throughout the streets of Arkham. Frightened citizens have sealed themselves in their homes, yet you continue to patrol the streets, desperate for some solution to end the chaos.

In In the Clutches of Chaos, doom does not accrue at the usual rate. Instead, breaches are made at various locations, marked by resource tokens. When enough breaches have been made a single location, an incursion occurs. An incursion adds doom to its location and causes the breaches to spread, opening rifts in reality at connecting locations. Your goal is to prevent incursions by removing the breaches that cause them, but this can only be done by activating the action abilities on each location. If you do not maintain control over the breaches, you may soon find yourself overwhelmed with Arkham falling into madness. You cannot allow that to happen!

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – The Circle Undone
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Aeon's End: Echo Stone and Splinter Missile Promo
Description:
Includes 21 card dividers and 14 player cards.

7 X Echo Stone is a gem that allows players to gain an additional aether on their turn if they have played another Echo Stone in the same turn.
5 X Splinter Missile is a spell that not only deals damage, but if an ally discards a card, allows players to divide the damage among any number of minions.

The promo were added to Kickstarter backers post campaign and were available to retailers as promotional items.

—user summary

Name: Tides of Time: Demo Deck
Description:
The Tides of Time Demo Deck is great way to introduce players to this fast, fun, and easy-to-play game.
The demo deck contains just six cards, but that’s all you will need to understand and get a feel for how the game plays.

Name: Butt Hurt
Description:
Butt Hurt is a card game played among friends that reveals the, sometimes uncomfortable, truth. This game is not designed for sensitive people who get butt hurt easily. Man up and have fun! Butt Hurt game is not intended to be taken seriously.The first Reader reads a question card and privately votes for the person they think best matches question. Each player privately chooses who they think the Reader will choose. Each player that matches the Reader receives a point. Whichever player received the most votes gets to keep that card to read at the end of the game. Each person will take turns being the Reader, playing two rounds of red cards (BAD) & two rounds of blue cards (GOOD). The player with the most points at the end of the game wins. At the end of the game, each person reads the cards they have collected as their story. For example: I am out of shape and likely to steal your stuff, but I am the best motivational speaker who will always answer your call.

—description from the publisher

Name: Depression
Description:
Play through a day of life for someone suffering from depression. Work to complete a series of increasingly difficult tasks, all while fighting the lack of motivation that comes with depression.
The goal of Depression is to complete six goals of increasing difficulty.

On each turn, you will discard cards from your hand either to use special abilities, or to complete a Goal card. You will end your turn by refilling your hand to five cards.

Completed Goal cards offer you help in completing future Goals. If you draw a Depression card, you must place it on top of a completed Goal card. To clear a Depression card, you must discard three cards of different types, or five cards total from your hand.

You win the game if you complete all six Goal cards. You lose the game immediately if the Draw Deck runs out before you have completed six goals.

-description from designer

Name: MP-44
Description:
A tactical WWII wargame that was published in the first issue of JagdPanther magazine. Eight generic scenarios were included for portraying conflicts involving German, American, and Russian forces. MP-44 is currently available in PDF format as Amarillo Design Bureau has digitally rereleased all fifteen JagdPanther issues.

—user summary

Mp44 [sic] is a squad level (10-12 man) game of infantry combat in WWII. In many ways it is the illigitemate [sic] child of Panzerblitz and Grunt. But it is distinctive and in many ways superior to both ... In this game we have squads of 14 men, and we have teams of two ... Some may complain that the game is too close to Panzerblitz. Well, part of that us intentional. I saw no reason to require the gamer to learn a new game system when most are familiar with Panzerblitz. For that reason, I left the factors where they were on the counter, and used, for all practical purposes, the same CRT ... Besides, this game is sort of a companion to PzB, allowing you to get closer to the action. Basically, we had to contend with Bolt-action rifles, semi-automatic rifles, machine pistols, and machine guns. Assault rifles are also included, and the heavier fire factors are indicative of the fire-generation of these weapons. The Vietnam type infantry provided for the Americans include not only assault rifles, but Grenade Launchers - pocket cannon ... German paratroopers might carry rifles, smg, or assault rifles ... Any differences in the relative intelligence or training or minor differences in weapons are reflected in reduced or increased range, reflecting more or less disciplined fire.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kradia: The Garden of Adventurers
Description:
<Kradia: The Garden of Adventurers> is the first game (fantasy themed RPG) of Kradia series. It allows 2-4 players, and is published in Chinese. In the first episode, there are 6 main acts and 2 side acts. Each act has its own story, map and boss, players can build the map with the wooden chess board.

Each player will act as an adventurer to explore the treasure continent “Kradia”, competing with other adventures for the greatest wealth. Through the journey, you may meet new companions to join your party, get useful items or treasure, battle monsters or other adventurers, and encounter the final boss. When the night comes, strange vision may happen and affect the whole map, the raid boss could move and attack the adventurers actively!

Name: Feed Ze Troll
Description:
Loot the caves of your opponents by avoiding to take the blow of club which will make you lose all your booty. To help you: Observe, listen and analyze what your opponents are doing ... unless they bluff you!

In each round, one player defends his cave (of 5 levels) from the attacks of the other player who want to loot him. Place your traps on the different tiles of each level and bluff (or not) the other players to try to hit them and keep your booty !!

The other players can try to loot you on different level of your cave with the risk to fall on a trap or stop the loot and secure their booty on a barrel.

After all the players have defended their cave, the player with the most important booty behind his screen win the game.

Name: Butterfly Effect
Description:
Butterfly Effect is a cooperative card game with the theme of butterfly effect.

Each player must cooperate with other players to tie themselves together with the items that were issued to the start and end given.

Please enjoy yourself with the very small opportunities that are normally thought to be negligible, but eventually become big things that can not be ignored.

Name: Fast Factory
Description:
Although Fast Factory , six cars will be shipped within the time limit, becoming a dwarf "Sashigoin" dripping somewhere.

If we do not ship 6 carriages within the time limit, everyone is game over.

In addition, "Sakigoin" are actually qualified and work at the factory. Let's ship more cars and parts than other dwarfs and win the Best Dodgers Award this month!

There are "tires", "bodies", "engines", "interior", "exterior", "options" on the card.

Among them, three types of cards, tires, body, and engine with color are called "key parts", and at minimum this card can be shipped as it will be a moving car if it is complete.

The upper three white cards can increase the added value of the car by installing it in the car being assembled.

There are two places to assemble cars, one for each "key parts", you can place any number of cards except key parts.

Players put out the cards in turn, and if all six key parts can be shipped and shipped, the game is clear.

The parts are the finest items (?) With which the dwarfs refer to various cars. Let's make fun cars with chaos that jumped over the genre!

—description from the publisher

Name: Wühlmäuse
Description:
Story and goal

All children are rooting in the leaves. Because under the colorful foliage  many animals have hidden - also fruits and cones are below it.

Each turn adds an extra sheet with a new theme mixed on the  bottom among the others.

Who finds it the first to root?

Preparation:

a) Sort out the leaves with pictures and put them in the bag.

The other leaves are distributed on the "forest floor" in the box bottom. Then you put the coins next to the Box ready.

The youngest player starts, then it goes clockwise continue.

If you are the youngest child, take the fabric bag and take out a sheet without  looking into it. Look at the motive on the underside secret, without the others can see.

Remember this motif and hide it under the leaves in the box  while the other players turn around.

If you have hidden the sheet, your teammates - with one hand - dig in the pile of foliage, just for this new one

To search motive. The leaves may be opened and closed

Be careful, but be careful when digging: Leaves must remain in the box.

Anyone who thinks they have found the new motive they are looking for calls the name of  the animal or the fruit.

     Was it correct, the player may take a gold coin. The sheet comes back in the box, in such a way that the picture is hidden.
     If it is wrong, the other players may (only) continue to dig,


until one  finds the right motive and gets a gold coin.

At the end of the game:

As soon as the last motive has been found in the heap of leaves and given the correct name, the game is over. Who has collected the most gold coins, wins the game! If two or more players have the same number of coins, they win together.

Have fun digging, grumbling, rustling and finding!

Name: Ark of Atlantis
Description:
Introduction:

Ark of Atlantis is a worker placement style board game. During each turn, players work hard to collect resources, save creatures, and find artifacts all while trying to build a ship large enough to save all of their workers before Atlantis sinks. As players race against time and each other, Atlantis continues to sink around them. Players must juggle their time between building a ship to save themselves and risking everything in order to save all that Atlantis holds dear. Players receive bonus points for risking and saving precious items from around the island before they too are lost to the sea. 


The Goal of the Game:

The goal of the game is to acquire more victory points than any other player. Players receive victory points for building ship sections, collecting treasure tokens, and selling resources. Players lose victory points for each worker they were unable to save at the end of the game.

How Ark of Atlantis Plays:
 Players take turns placing their workers around the island. On a player’s turn they can collect resources, build ship sections, or save valuable creatures, treasures, potions, and rare books from around the island to gain extra victory points. Each time a player places a worker or a group of workers they must then move their time track marker forward for each worker they placed. In Ark of Atlantis, the turn order is constantly changing depending on where a player’s time track marker is positioned on the time track. If a player’s marker lands on or passes over an event space the player draws an event card and then resolves it by flipping over an island tile. The second time an island tile would be flipped it is removed from the game. The game ends once all island tiles have been removed. Next, players tally up their victory points by adding any bonus points or deducting points for each worker they were unable to save. The player with the most points wins the game.

-description from designer

Name: Twee tot de zesde macht
Description:
Play the popular TV quiz now at home, and discover which team will become "the highest exponent". To make a chance to win the game, each duo has to bundle their forces and outdo themselves and not by a little.

Knowledge alone won't be enough in "Twee tot de zesde macht".
Associative thinking, reacting quickly and being well-matched make the difference between winning and losing. Play the well-known rounds from the TV quiz like the roster, the 4 answers, and double right.

—user summary

Name: Scrimmage IV
Description:
A hex-and-counter simulation of American football, focused on portraying only a portion of a full game. The "I go, you go" rules cover movement, collisions (resolved on a "CRT"), forward passes, and hand-offs. Each counter represents one football player defined by two factors: power and movement points. The simplified football rules do not cover fumbles or penalties.

Scrimmage IV was published in the first issue of JagdPanther magazine which has been rereleased in PDF format by Amarillo Design Bureau.

...a whole [football] game would take months [to play], but for a quick series or a key play, here is a fun way to waste an hour.

—description from the designer

Name: The Battle of Cowpens
Description:
On January 17, 1781, Banastre Tareltons' [sic] Brigade of Light Infantry broke cover shortly after dawn, and faced a low hill sloping to a crest about 1/2 a mile away. A few hundred yards away were the American Rangers, the three light infantry companies that formed the pickets of the American position. Behind them, about half way up the slop stood 300 American Militiamen, none of them eager to face the enemy. But at the crest stood the American line. Six hundred regulars, they were the heart of the American force. Wearing bright blue uniforms, they stood in straight lines measured carefully by their officers. At the crest of the hill stood Morgan, the swashbuckling American light infantry commander. The British had chased him for two weeks, and now they had him, for he could go no further.

This game is at best an experiment in muzzle-loading warfare. If it works out, and I feel it has, we shall produce a line of such games.

—description from the publisher

A game depicting the American Revolutionary War battle of Cowpens. The game does not define its time or unit scales.

American units, except for cavalry, are deployed on the map. Cavalry units being off-map but are allowed to enter at any time. British units enter the map on designated turns during the first nine turns of the game. The turn order starts with one side firing, moving, and then designating bayonet assaults. This is followed by a defensive fire phase, after which the bayonet assaults are resolved. The opponent then executes the same phases which constitutes a completed game turn.

A CRT is used for combat resolution. Unit rankings include an attack factor, defense factor, movement factor, and range. Victory conditions are based on points received for destruction of units, ranging from 3 points for destruction of a militia unit to 10 points for destruction of a cannon unit. You win by scoring 10 or more victory points than your opponent. A margin of less than 10 victory points results in a draw.

The Battle of Cowpens was published in the first issue of JagdPanther magazine. While the rules and counters for the game were re-released in a 2012 PDF reprint of the magazine, the game's map could not be located and the publisher has asked for a scan of the map from anyone who owns the original edition.

—user summary
